alert.note: Alert for York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 5:37PM EDT until May 02 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Continued flooding caused by last night`s and this morning`s excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Franklin, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Oxford, Sagadahoc, Somerset and York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Belknap, Carroll, Coos, Grafton, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 532 PM EDT, Flooding from earlier heavy rain. Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood prime locations is occurring. Even though the heavy rain has ended, streams and rivers will continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, Rochester, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Portsmouth, Brunswick, Augusta and Westbrook.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
